dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of Infringing/Phishing Activity]
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of The Planet
Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Thursday, April 27, 2006 1:00 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of
Infringing/Phishing Activity]
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of Infringing/Phishing
Activity]


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the address
of copyright@theplanet.com. Furthermore, please note that we were unable to find any
evidence of phishing activity on the site.
Should you have further evidence of phishing taking place, please send it to
abuse@theplanet.com for further review and investigation.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of Infringing/Phishing Activity
Date: Thu, 27 Apr 2006 17:49:02 +0300
From: Pavel Novikov <pavel@ext.by>
To: abuse@theplanet.com

Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of Infringing/Phishing Activity

URL: http://www.helpershosting.com/
IP: 70.85.136.36

27 April 2006

Dear Sir or Madam,

This letter serves as notification under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, 17
U.S.C. з 512, or equivalent notice provisions of your local law, that content
currently residing within your computer system infringes on the copyrights of
Extmedia Unitary Enterprise. Moreover, the source code contains proprietary
information belonging to Extmedia Unitary Enterprise. I am authorized to act on
behalf of Extmedia Unitary Enterprise in this matter.

The infringing material residing on your system is the web site design stolen from
our site http://extmedia.com. The domain helpershosting.com was just registered on
2d April but our design exists for about 2 years that can be proven by a cached copy
of our website from web.archive.org.

Moreover this site seems to us to act like a phishing site that is designated to
steal private information of our clients.

Usage of our web site design is not authorized by Extmedia Unitary Enterprise or by
law.  Pursuant to this notification, you should immediately take steps to locate and
remove and/or disable access to the site that violates the law that is on your
system at the web address detailed above.

As a service provider, you may otherwise be liable for copyright infringement if,
upon obtaining knowledge or awareness of infringing material being stored upon your
network, you do not act expeditiously to remove, or disable access to, the material.
17 U.S.C. з 512(c).

The information in this notification is accurate.  I swear under penalty of perjury
that I am authorized to act on behalf of Extmedia Unitary Enterprise in regard to
its exclusive rights in the work(s) identified above that I believe has been and
continues to be infringed as described above.

We hereby give notice of these activities to you and request that you take
expeditious action to remove or disable access to the material described above, and
thereby prevent the illegal reproduction and distribution via your company's
network.

We appreciate your cooperation in this matter. Please advise us regarding what
actions you take.

Yours sincerely,

Pavel Novikov
CTO, Extmedia Unitary Enterprise
http://extmedia.com




-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFEUQavvK/XpJs6oyURAsqxAKCasAhhlVqzgCX4kJpYhvgDLJ04UACfW93B
f0k89zVfrAILhmA6Yxk+G98=
=DCF6
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
